title: Introducing tmux-rs
author: Jtsummers
aiHeadline: Finally, after years of suffering, a Rust developer has released tmux-rs, because clearly the world needed yet another terminal multiplexer—probably because the original tmux wasn't already good enough, or maybe because someone had a mental breakdown and decided to rewrite it in Rust just for fun.

title: Astronomers discover 3I/ATLAS – Third interstellar object to visit Solar System
author: gammarator
aiHeadline: Astronomers have discovered the third interstellar object to visit our solar system, proving that space is full of weird rocks just like Earth, but somehow this still manages to be less exciting than a new season of The Bachelor.

title: Tools: Code Is All You Need
author: Bogdanp
aiHeadline: In a shocking revelation, a developer has declared that 'Code Is All You Need,' which is either the most obvious statement of the century or a thinly veiled attempt to justify why they refuse to learn proper documentation practices.

title: Opening up ‘Zero-Knowledge Proof’ technology
author: doomroot13
aiHeadline: Google has decided to 'open up' zero-knowledge proof technology, which is great news for everyone who wasn't already aware that 'open' in corporate speak usually means 'we'll give you just enough to make you feel involved while keeping the real power for ourselves.'

title: Peasant Railgun
author: cainxinth
aiHeadline: The 'Peasant Railgun' has officially been added to D&D 5e, proving once and for all that even in a fantasy setting, peasants are still the real heroes—because who else would be stuck using a railgun that's basically just a glorified potato cannon?
